title: Using the selectInferToolkit Package
text: era big data complex regression problems, researchers often employ model selection procedures like step wise regression penalized methods (e.g., lasso) identify important variables. However, classical statistical inference assumes model chosen prior—independent data. assumption violated, standard statistical tests confidence intervals can become overly optimistic, leading unreliable conclusions. selectInferToolkit aims provide user-friendly framework R facilitate post-selection inferential methods model selection methods.

title: Using the selectInferToolkit Package
text: conventional stepwise selection algorithms, employed “forward”, “backward” “bidirectional” (also known “bidirectional elimination”) methods. Forward selection begins empty model progressively adds significant predictors. process continues statistically significant improvements observed predefined criterion. Backward selection starts full model includes predictors systematically removes least significant predictors. process stops remaining predictors statistically significant predefined criterion. stepwise selection approach allows model add variables (forward selection) remove variables (backward elimination) step, based specific criteria determine best-fitting model. used Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) model selection stepwise regression. Penalized regression methods aim minimize log-likelihood function constraint penalizes large absolute values coefficients /model complexity. L1 penalty used lasso (sum absolute values regression coefficients multiplied penalty factor, λ\lambda), enables simultaneous variable selection coefficient estimation, making particularly useful high-dimensional settings. However, one limitation lasso , presence multicollinearity, tends select one variable group highly correlated variables exclude others. Additionally, highly correlated variables, estimation can become unstable, lasso may perform well Ridge regression uses L2 penalty (sum squares regression coefficients multiplied respective penalty factors). elastic net combines L1 L2 penalties, introducing additional penalty factor provide stability model estimation allowing robust variable selection, particularly presence multicollinearity. Finally, minimax concave penalty (MCP) alternative method produces less biased regression coefficients sparse models. MCP includes additional tuning parameter, γ\gamma, controls concavity penalty (.e., quickly penalty decreases). Many additional forms penalized regression proposed, focus set package.

title: Using the selectInferToolkit Package
text: (construction)

title: Using the selectInferToolkit Package
text: first approach involves ignoring model selection process (matter model selection method used) making inferences final selected model. ‘unadjusted post-selection inference’ (UPSI) approach, sometimes referred two-stage hybrid solution inference post-regularization, first use stepwise/penalized model select variables, fit OLS model selected variables obtain standard errors CIs. , invalid scenarios, recent research (Zhao et el.) suggests , certain conditions—specifically, sample size large, true model sparse, predictors low mutual correlations—set variables selected lasso converge deterministic set high probability. provide method standardize implementation practice.

title: Using the selectInferToolkit Package
text: package provides two different ways implement non-parametric bootstrap based target inference. Bootstrap CIs Selected Model Let ss model selection procedure yielding prime model M̂s⊂{1,…,p}\hat{M}_s \subset \{1, \dots, p\}. estimate β̂∣M̂s\hat{\beta} \mid \hat{M}_s, .e., coefficients conditional selected model. j∈M̂sj \\hat{M}_s, coefficient β̂j\hat{\beta}_j; otherwise, NA. Bootstrap CIs Variables inference targets pp variables: Resample data replacement. Apply ss resample. et coefficients non-selections zero. Resample data replacement. Apply ss resample. selection, regress residuals non-selected variable individually. yield bootstrap distributions variables, enabling CI calculation. option refit OLS within iteration (essentially debiased bootstrap approach).
code: *Procedure:*   - For each bootstrap iteration:       1. Resample data with replacement.       2. Apply \( s \) to the resample.       3. Record coefficients for \( j \in \hat{M}_s \); set to zero if missing.       4. Compute CIs from bootstrap quantiles.

title: Using the selectInferToolkit Package
text: Selective inference post-selection inferential technique focuses making valid inferences coefficients conditioning model selection process implemented selectiveInference R package. Currently, ’re available using forward step wise selection lasso regression select model. details method, consult documentation selectiveInference R package associated paper. rest document goes several use cases package different data sets.

code: @Manual{,   title = {selectInferToolkit: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference},   author = {Jinal Shah and Ryan A Peterson},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.4.1},   url = {https://petersonr.github.io/selectInferToolkit/}, }

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: selectInferToolkit package aims addresses critical challenge modern statistical modeling: conducting valid inference performing model selection. era big data complex regression problems, researchers often employ model selection procedures like stepwise regression penalized methods (e.g., lasso) identify important variables. However, classical statistical inference assumes model chosen priori—independent data. assumption violated, standard statistical tests confidence intervals can become overly optimistic, leading unreliable conclusions.selectInferToolkit provides user-friendly framework R facilitate post-selection inferential methods.

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: can install development version selectInferToolkit like :
code: devtools::install_github("petersonR/selectInferToolkit")

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: selectInferToolkit offers comprehensive suite tools, covering model selection crucial post-selection inference steps.

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: package supports two broad classes popular model selection techniques: Stepwise Regression: Implement forward, backward, bidirectional stepwise regression. User can use either Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) selection criteria, leveraging stepAIC function MASS package. λmin\lambda_{min} represents regularization parameter λ\lambda minimizes cross-validation error, aiming best predictive performance. λ1se\lambda_{1se} conservative choice, selecting largest λ\lambda cross-validation error within one standard error λmin\lambda_{min}. often results sparser, parsimonious model.

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: core contribution selectInferToolkit lies ability provide straightforward implementations three distinct post-selection inference methods, applicable ’ve performed model selection using one methods : UPSI: baseline approach performs adjustment selection process. refer “unadjusted post-selection inference”, “UPSI” short. Others refer “hybrid-OLS” (Gaussian outcome case). Bootstrap: non-parametric bootstrap method resamples data account selection uncertainty. Selective Inference: theoretically grounded approach, currently available lasso forward stepwise selection integration selectiveInference package. PIPE: [currently experimental]

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: selectInferToolkit explicity handling non-selections, can set : Ignored: Treating non-selected variables irrelevant. Confident (point-mass) nulls: Assuming variables exactly zero effect. Uncertain nulls: Aim make inference variables without assumption non-selections certainly null effect

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: bootstrapping, methods handling nonselections similar slightly altered. allow user specify inference_target either "selections" "", debias varies whether coefficients re-fit selection prior bootstrapped aggregation, estimation_data either "-sample" "--sample" facilitates estimation coefficients ‘left-’ data model fit within bootstrapped sample (similar sample spliting). details bootstrapping approach forthcoming.

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: Let’s say wanting predict gas mileage based variables mtcars data set. Hmm, R2R^2 high nothing “significant”. going ? model probably -specified. Let’s use selectInferToolkit narrow think important factors . step_ic function can forwards backwards selection via AIC default.
code: library(selectInferToolkit) #> Loading required package: broom library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  data("mtcars")  fit_full <- lm(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars) summary(fit_full) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = mpg ~ ., data = mtcars) #>  #> Residuals: #>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max  #> -3.4506 -1.6044 -0.1196  1.2193  4.6271  #>  #> Coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)   #> (Intercept) 12.30337   18.71788   0.657   0.5181   #> cyl         -0.11144    1.04502  -0.107   0.9161   #> disp         0.01334    0.01786   0.747   0.4635   #> hp          -0.02148    0.02177  -0.987   0.3350   #> drat         0.78711    1.63537   0.481   0.6353   #> wt          -3.71530    1.89441  -1.961   0.0633 . #> qsec         0.82104    0.73084   1.123   0.2739   #> vs           0.31776    2.10451   0.151   0.8814   #> am           2.52023    2.05665   1.225   0.2340   #> gear         0.65541    1.49326   0.439   0.6652   #> carb        -0.19942    0.82875  -0.241   0.8122   #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 2.65 on 21 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:  0.869,  Adjusted R-squared:  0.8066  #> F-statistic: 13.93 on 10 and 21 DF,  p-value: 3.793e-07

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: Functions prefixed select_ create selector class object. can pass selector objects coef, predict, tidy() functions: find AIC selects wt, cyl, hp. p-values?! post-selection inference comes ; p-values adjust selective process small. , call “unadjusted post-selection inference” (UPSI, short). Thus, wt significant! know confidence interval may biased precise, ’ve used data select model now using data perform inference (UPSI!). wanted adjust uncertainty quantification selective process? selection process default infer method , part, UPSI method. default stepwise selection via information criteria bootstrapping. code equivalent calling infer_boot. results less promising. can also use wrapper selectiveInference method: see adjusting selective process, unable claim significance effects (quite large CIs). Lastly, stated post-selection inference method, provide three approaches handling non-selections: ignored (ignoring ), confident_nulls (treating confident (point-mass) degenerate nulls zero), uncertain_nulls (treating uncertain). details theses methods, see package vignette.
code: fit_aic <- select_stepwise_ic(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars, penalty = "AIC")  fit_aic #> Stepwise IC-based selector #> 3 of 10 variables selected: hp, cyl, wt  #> Meta information: family=gaussian, select_factors_together=TRUE, penalty=AIC, direction=forward  #> Default `infer()` method: boot coef(fit_aic) #> (Intercept)          wt         cyl          hp  #>   20.090625   -3.098748   -1.681654   -1.236744 tidy(fit_aic) #> # A tibble: 11 × 3 #>    term        selected  coef #>    <chr>          <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1  #>  2 cyl                1 -1.68 #>  3 disp               0  0    #>  4 hp                 1 -1.24 #>  5 drat               0  0    #>  6 wt                 1 -3.10 #>  7 qsec               0  0    #>  8 vs                 0  0    #>  9 am                 0  0    #> 10 gear               0  0    #> 11 carb               0  0 fit_aic_infer_upsi <- infer_upsi(fit_aic, data = mtcars) fit_aic_infer_upsi #> Unadjusted Post-Selection Inference (UPSI) inference applied post Stepwise IC-based Selection  #> 3 of 10 variables selected.  #> Nonselections were considered ignored  #> Meta information: none  #> Median CI length = 3; mean = 2.9; max = 3.9 tidy(fit_aic_infer_upsi) %>% dplyr::filter(selected == 1) #> # A tibble: 4 × 7 #>   term        selected  coef estimate ci_low ci_high  p_value #>   <chr>          <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)        1 20.1     20.1   19.2   21.0   9.94e-28 #> 2 cyl                1 -1.68    -1.68  -3.61   0.247 9.85e- 2 #> 3 hp                 1 -1.24    -1.24  -2.83   0.359 1.40e- 1 #> 4 wt                 1 -3.10    -3.10  -4.52  -1.68  1.99e- 4 set.seed(1) fit_aic_infer_boot <- infer(fit_aic, data = mtcars, B = 100) fit_aic_infer_boot #> Bootstrap inference applied post Stepwise IC-based Selection  #> 3 of 10 variables selected.  #> Nonselections were considered N/A  #> Meta information: B=100, inference_target=selections, debias=TRUE, estimation_data=in-sample  #> Median CI length = 7.8; mean = 7.1; max = 9.7 tidy(fit_aic_infer_boot)  #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    term        selected  coef estimate ci_low ci_high prop_selected #>    <chr>          <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1    20.1    18.7    21.7           1    #>  2 cyl                1 -1.68   -0.357  -4.19    3.99          0.51 #>  3 disp               0  0      NA      NA      NA            NA    #>  4 hp                 1 -1.24   -1.42   -5.70    1.66          0.5  #>  5 drat               0  0      NA      NA      NA            NA    #>  6 wt                 1 -3.10   -3.21   -8.05    1.64          0.88 #>  7 qsec               0  0      NA      NA      NA            NA    #>  8 vs                 0  0      NA      NA      NA            NA    #>  9 am                 0  0      NA      NA      NA            NA    #> 10 gear               0  0      NA      NA      NA            NA    #> 11 carb               0  0      NA      NA      NA            NA fit_aic_SI <- infer_selective(fit_aic, data = mtcars) fit_aic_SI  #> Selective inference applied post Stepwise IC-based Selection  #> 3 of 10 variables selected.  #> Nonselections were considered ignored  #> Meta information: none  #> Median CI length = Inf; mean = Inf; max = Inf tidy(fit_aic_SI)  #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    term        selected  coef estimate ci_low ci_high p_value #>    <chr>          <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1     NA      NA     NA     NA     #>  2 cyl                1 -1.68     1.68 -Inf     38.0    0.235 #>  3 disp               0  0       NA      NA     NA     NA     #>  4 hp                 1 -1.24     1.24  -32.2  Inf      0.795 #>  5 drat               0  0       NA      NA     NA     NA     #>  6 wt                 1 -3.10     3.10  -13.2    7.59   0.224 #>  7 qsec               0  0       NA      NA     NA     NA     #>  8 vs                 0  0       NA      NA     NA     NA     #>  9 am                 0  0       NA      NA     NA     NA     #> 10 gear               0  0       NA      NA     NA     NA     #> 11 carb               0  0       NA      NA     NA     NA

title: Tools for Variable Selection & Inference
text: can also try selecting important factors penalized models. can fit lasso cross validation selects coefficients associated best predicting model (default, .e. lambda.min) compact model predicts well best model, .e. lambda.1se. lasso also selects 3 variables. lasso alone provide p-value CI inference, UPSIs aside can perform (questionable) hybrid inferential process ordinary least squares theory used inference though never used data selection. results look familiar: since model selected lasso selected stepwise AIC, UPSI inference method identical; wt still seemingly significant. Selective inference see adjusting selective process selective inference, able assert significant effect wt even selective process. CI term slightly wide full model. Bootstrapping + debiasing debias bootrapped estimates, longer “confident” non-selection akin coefficient zero, thereby treating non-selections “uncertain nulls”. may case ’re interesting making inferences variables, including selected prime model using full data. obtain bootstrap distribution β̂j\hat{\beta}_j proceed follows: B iterations, re sample data replacement, apply model selection method re sampled data, save coefficients selected variables. variable selected given bootstrap sample, regress model residuals non-selected variables separately get beta estimates non-selections. , ’re trying explain residual variance variables selected model selection method. process produces bootstrap distribution pp variables, allowing us calculate CIs using quantiles distributions. approach, see wt CI intersect zero, indicating significant effect. Compare results debias = FALSE: depth tutorial examples different methods, please consult package vignette.
code: set.seed(12) fit_lso <- select_glmnet(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars)  fit_lso  #> Penalized `glmnet`-based selector #> 4 of 10 variables selected: am, hp, cyl, wt  #> Meta information: family=gaussian, lambda=best, lambda_used=0.654, cv_info=list(...), ellipses=list(...)  #> Default `infer()` method: selective tidy(fit_lso) #> # A tibble: 11 × 3 #>    term        selected     coef #>    <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1     #>  2 cyl                1 -1.59    #>  3 disp               0  0       #>  4 hp                 1 -0.879   #>  5 drat               0  0       #>  6 wt                 1 -2.72    #>  7 qsec               0  0       #>  8 vs                 0  0       #>  9 am                 1  0.00672 #> 10 gear               0  0       #> 11 carb               0  0 fit_lasso_infer_upsi <-infer_upsi(fit_lso, data = mtcars)  tidy(fit_lasso_infer_upsi) #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    term        selected     coef estimate ci_low ci_high   p_value #>    <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1       20.1   19.2    21.0    5.23e-27 #>  2 cyl                1 -1.59      -1.33  -3.37    0.709  2.12e- 1 #>  3 disp               0  0         NA     NA      NA     NA        #>  4 hp                 1 -0.879     -1.71  -3.54    0.123  7.86e- 2 #>  5 drat               0  0         NA     NA      NA     NA        #>  6 wt                 1 -2.72      -2.55  -4.31   -0.786  8.60e- 3 #>  7 qsec               0  0         NA     NA      NA     NA        #>  8 vs                 0  0         NA     NA      NA     NA        #>  9 am                 1  0.00672    0.738 -0.672   2.15   3.14e- 1 #> 10 gear               0  0         NA     NA      NA     NA        #> 11 carb               0  0         NA     NA      NA     NA fit_lasso_infer_SI <- infer_selective(fit_lso, data = mtcars) tidy(fit_lasso_infer_SI) #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    term        selected     coef estimate  ci_low ci_high   p_value #>    <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1       NA       NA     NA     NA        #>  2 cyl                1 -1.59      -1.33  -Inf      0.213  0.0147   #>  3 disp               0  0         NA       NA     NA     NA        #>  4 hp                 1 -0.879     -1.71    -2.35 Inf      0.947    #>  5 drat               0  0         NA       NA     NA     NA        #>  6 wt                 1 -2.72      -2.55  -Inf     -2.22   0.000395 #>  7 qsec               0  0         NA       NA     NA     NA        #>  8 vs                 0  0         NA       NA     NA     NA        #>  9 am                 1  0.00672    0.738 -Inf      0.504  0.981    #> 10 gear               0  0         NA       NA     NA     NA        #> 11 carb               0  0         NA       NA     NA     NA set.seed(1) fit_lasso_infer_boot <- infer_boot(fit_lso, data = mtcars, B = 100, inference_target = "all", debias = TRUE)  tidy(fit_lasso_infer_boot)  #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    term        selected     coef estimate ci_low ci_high prop_selected #>    <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1       20.1   19.3    21.1            1    #>  2 cyl                1 -1.59      -0.542 -3.21    3.51           0.9  #>  3 disp               0  0          1.28  -1.06    4.97           0.09 #>  4 hp                 1 -0.879     -1.23  -3.40    1.32           0.82 #>  5 drat               0  0          0.616 -0.541   2.91           0.44 #>  6 wt                 1 -2.72      -2.61  -5.34   -0.626          1    #>  7 qsec               0  0          0.910 -1.19    2.93           0.11 #>  8 vs                 0  0          0.157 -1.49    2.48           0.23 #>  9 am                 1  0.00672    0.881 -0.599   2.47           0.43 #> 10 gear               0  0          0.393 -1.32    3.10           0.06 #> 11 carb               0  0         -0.885 -2.72    0.926          0.51 set.seed(1) fit_lasso_infer_boot <- infer_boot(fit_lso, data = mtcars, B = 100, inference_target = "all", debias = FALSE)  tidy(fit_lasso_infer_boot)  #> # code: set.seed(12) fit_mcp <- select_ncvreg(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars)  fit_mcp  #> Penalized `ncvreg`-based selector #> 2 of 10 variables selected: qsec, wt  #> Meta information: family=gaussian, penalty=MCP, lambda=best, lambda_used=0.73, lambda_seq=list(...), cv_info=list(...), ellipses=list(...)  #> Default `infer()` method: pipe tidy(fit_mcp) #> # A tibble: 11 × 3 #>    term        selected  coef #>    <chr>          <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1  #>  2 cyl                0  0    #>  3 disp               0  0    #>  4 hp                 0  0    #>  5 drat               0  0    #>  6 wt                 1 -4.99 #>  7 qsec               1  1.37 #>  8 vs                 0  0    #>  9 am                 0  0    #> 10 gear               0  0    #> 11 carb               0  0 fit_mcp_infer_upsi <- infer_upsi(fit_mcp, data = mtcars)  tidy(fit_mcp_infer_upsi) #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    term        selected  coef estimate ci_low ci_high   p_value #>    <chr>          <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1     20.1  19.2     21.0   4.84e-28 #>  2 cyl                0  0       NA    NA       NA    NA        #>  3 disp               0  0       NA    NA       NA    NA        #>  4 hp                 0  0       NA    NA       NA    NA        #>  5 drat               0  0       NA    NA       NA    NA        #>  6 wt                 1 -4.99    -4.94 -5.87    -4.01  2.52e-11 #>  7 qsec               1  1.37     1.66  0.732    2.59  1.50e- 3 #>  8 vs                 0  0       NA    NA       NA    NA        #>  9 am                 0  0       NA    NA       NA    NA        #> 10 gear               0  0       NA    NA       NA    NA        #> 11 carb               0  0       NA    NA       NA    NA set.seed(12) fit_mcp_infer_boot <- infer_boot(fit_mcp, data = mtcars, B = 100, inference_target = "all", debias = FALSE)  tidy(fit_mcp_infer_boot)  #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    term        selected  coef  estimate ci_low ci_high prop_selected #>    <chr>          <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1  20.1       19.1    21.0           1    #>  2 cyl                0  0    -1.33      -5.54    0             0.37 #>  3 disp               0  0    -0.397     -4.85    0             0.09 #>  4 hp                 0  0    -0.283     -4.74    0             0.07 #>  5 drat               0  0     0.0157     0       0             0.02 #>  6 wt                 1 -4.99 -3.24      -6.32    0             0.76 #>  7 qsec               1  1.37  0.575      0       2.13          0.45 #>  8 vs                 0  0     0          0       0             0    #>  9 am                 0  0     0.136      0       1.73          0.12 #> 10 gear               0  0     0.000184   0       0             0.01 #> 11 carb               0  0    -0.169     -1.84    0             0.2 set.seed(12) fit_mcp_infer_boot <- infer_boot(fit_mcp, data = mtcars, B = 100, inference_target = "all", debias = TRUE)  tidy(fit_mcp_infer_boot)  #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    term        selected  coef estimate ci_low ci_high prop_selected #>    <chr>          <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 (Intercept)        1 20.1   20.1    19.2    21.0            1    #>  2 cyl                0  0     -1.69   -5.56    1.23           0.37 #>  3 disp               0  0     -0.0320 -4.37    2.52           0.09 #>  4 hp                 0  0     -1.16   -4.62    0.778          0.07 #>  5 drat               0  0      0.521  -0.891   1.92           0.02 #>  6 wt                 1 -4.99  -3.56   -6.28   -0.543          0.76 #>  7 qsec               1  1.37   0.912  -1.02    2.24           0.45 #>  8 vs                 0  0     -0.0734 -2.02    1.23           0    #>  9 am                 0  0      0.915  -0.605   2.46           0.12 #> 10 gear               0  0      0.351  -1.12    2.52           0.01 #> 11 carb               0  0     -0.706  -2.19    0.385          0.2 fit_mcp_infer_pipe <- infer_pipe(fit_mcp, data = mtcars) tidy(fit_mcp_infer_pipe) #> # what: Inference for selector via bootstrapping — infer_boot
title: Inference for selector via bootstrapping — infer_boot
text: Inference selector via bootstrapping Bootstrapping selection process

title: Inference for selector via bootstrapping — infer_boot
code: infer_boot(   object,   data,   inference_target = c("selections", "all"),   debias = TRUE,   estimation_data = c("in-sample", "out-of-sample"),   conf.level = 0.95,   type = c("paired", "residual"),   B = 250,   n_cores = 4,   ... )  boot(   object,   data,   B,   inference_target = c("selections", "all"),   debias = TRUE,   estimation_data = c("in-sample", "out-of-sample"),   conf.level,   n_cores,   ... )

title: Inference for selector via bootstrapping — infer_boot
text: object selector object data data must passed infer inference_target inference requested selected debias estimates debiased (, non-selections, ) estimation_data within bootstrap, -sample --sample residuals used estimation (defaults FALSE) conf.level .95 default type type bootstrap (currently paired supported) B number bootstrap replicates. n_cores number cores parallel computation ... additional arguments can passed fitting engine

title: Inference for selector via bootstrapping — infer_boot

title: Constructor for inferrers — as_inferrer
text: Create inferrer wrapper around post-selection inference algorithms can used selectInferToolkit package can harmonize results across various selection algorithms (inferrers). user-facing function. function performs selector's default inference method. Alternative inference methods may available via infer_*, use instead want specific tuning. wrapper selectiveInference functions selector objects UPSI sometimes referred "hybrid-OLS", essentially re-fit selected model data though never used data fit model. common, easy, ill-advised.

title: Constructor for inferrers — as_inferrer
code: as_inferrer(   x,   name,   label = name,   nonselection,   inferences,   conf.level,   selector,   meta = list() )  infer(   object,   data,   nonselection = c("ignored", "uncertain_nulls", "confident_nulls"),   ... )  infer_pipe(object, data, conf.level = 0.95, ...)  infer_selective(   object,   data,   nonselection = c("ignored", "confident_nulls", "uncertain_nulls"),   conf.level = 0.95,   use_cv_sigma = FALSE,   ... )  infer_upsi(   object,   data,   nonselection = c("ignored", "confident_nulls", "uncertain_nulls"),   conf.level = 0.95 )

title: Constructor for inferrers — as_inferrer
text: x slot main inferential object name brief name method label label method nonselection character string specifying handle variables selected model selection procedure. One "ignored", "confident_nulls" "uncertain_nulls" supported inferences slot post-selection inferences confidence intervals (least) conf.level .95 default selector carried-forward selector object meta list containing important meta-information method object selector object data data must passed infer methods ... arguments passed selectiveInference function(s) use_cv_sigma estimate Sigma via CV (FALSE, uses SI defaults)

title: Constructor for inferrers — as_inferrer
text: S3 object (list) class inferrer list class infer_* containing:' ci_avg_ratio Average CI length across variables model ci_median_ratio median CI length across variables model nonselection method chosen  deal non selection infmethod Inference method chosen selection_method Stepwsie,returned selector_stepwise_ic class direction mode step wise search, returned selector_stepwise_ic class penalty penalty used (AIC BIC), returned selector_stepwise_ic class lambda selected lambda inference , either "lambda.min" "lambda.1se"; returned selector_pen class alpha selected alpha inference, returned selector_pen class B number bootstrap replicates used (bootstrap selection method) inferror object inferrer object inferrer object

title: Fit an (relaxed) lasso or elastic net penalized regression via glmnet — select_glmnet
text: formula formula data data set family outcome distributional family lambda can best, compact (use CV), numeric vector. See details. fitted_selector previously fit selector, used resampling ... Additional arguments can passed glmnet, e.g. alpha

title: Fit an (relaxed) lasso or elastic net penalized regression via glmnet — select_glmnet

Returns predictions selector objects new data Returns tibble candidate variables, estimates (scaled & unscaled) Returns vector selected coefficients (scaled , includes intercept) Re-selection, possibly new data. re-pre-processing; instead uses original preprocess recipe selector_obj.
